Fast Culture

June 2012

I was raised exclusively on books no tv, video at all.
I was reading more books than hours spent watching American, or any culture.

Then I had the chance to spend ten years taking all from Western culture, live or behind the monitor.

When I saw Angels in America (1993, won Pulitzer) I was shocked how close we are. And when I saw Shame (2011, won Venice Film Festival) this came to my mind.

Cultural penetration is incredibly fast. In maximum twenty years the entire world can be converted to Western culture.

But there is a difference — and will be — between those raised for generations inside the same culture and those who are adapting this new one.

Those who adapt will have a chance to compare, and to realise important patterns. Culture changes only minds but not environment.

That's why Technology is trying to make the environment digital.

This story is about culture. With focus on technology, speed.
